title: Define Simple Function
description: Define a function 'greet' that prints 'Hello, World!' when called.
hints: Use def keyword to define function

title: Function with Parameter
description: Define function 'greet_name' that takes a name parameter and prints 'Hello, {name}!'.
hints: Add parameter in parentheses after function name
Use f-string or .format() to insert name

title: Function with Return Value
description: Define function 'add' that takes two numbers and returns their sum.
hints: Use return keyword to return value

title: Multiple Parameters
description: Define 'full_name' that takes first_name and last_name, returns them combined with space.

title: Default Parameter Value
description: Define 'greet' with parameter name (default='World'). Returns 'Hello, {name}!'.

title: Function with Docstring
description: Define 'square' that returns x squared. Add docstring 'Returns the square of x'.
hints: Add triple-quoted string right after def line
Docstring should be 'Returns the square of x'

title: Return Multiple Values
description: Define 'min_max' that takes a list and returns tuple of (min, max) values.
hints: Return them as tuple: return min(lst), max(lst)

title: Function Returning Boolean
description: Define 'is_even' that returns True if number is even, False otherwise.

title: String Manipulation Function
description: Define 'reverse_string' that returns the reversed string.

title: List Operation Function
description: Define 'sum_list' that returns the sum of all numbers in a list.

title: Count Occurrences
description: Define 'count_char' that counts how many times a character appears in a string.

title: Filter List
description: Define 'get_evens' that returns a list of only even numbers from input list.
hints: Loop through list and check if num % 2 == 0
Append to new list or use list comprehension

title: Calculate Factorial
description: Define 'factorial' that returns n! (n factorial). Use iteration.
hints: Use loop to multiply: result *= i

title: Fibonacci Number
description: Define 'fibonacci' that returns the nth Fibonacci number (0-indexed).
hints: Use loop with two variables to track previous values

title: Check Palindrome
description: Define 'is_palindrome' that returns True if string reads same forwards and backwards.

title: Keyword Arguments
description: Define 'create_person' that takes name and age as keyword arguments, returns dict.
hints: Parameters can be called by name

title: Variable Arguments (*args)
description: Define 'sum_all' that takes any number of arguments and returns their sum.
hints: args becomes a tuple of all arguments

title: Keyword Arguments (**kwargs)
description: Define 'print_info' that accepts any keyword arguments and prints them as 'key: value'.

title: Mixed Arguments
description: Define 'describe' with positional arg 'name', *args for hobbies, **kwargs for details. Return formatted string.
hints: Format kwargs as key: value pairs

title: Simple Lambda Function
description: Create a lambda function that squares a number and assign it to 'square'.
hints: Assign to variable: square = lambda x: ...

title: Lambda with Two Arguments
description: Create lambda 'multiply' that takes two numbers and returns their product.
hints: Use lambda x, y: x * y

title: Using map() with Function
description: Use map() with lambda to square all numbers in [1, 2, 3, 4]. Print as list.

title: Using filter() with Lambda
description: Use filter() to get only numbers > 5 from [1, 8, 3, 9, 2, 6]. Print as list.

title: Sorted with Key Function
description: Sort ['apple', 'pie', 'a', 'cherry'] by length using sorted() with key parameter.

title: Nested Function
description: Define 'outer' that defines inner function 'inner' which returns 'Hello'. outer() should return inner().
hints: Call and return inner() from outer

title: Closure
description: Define 'multiplier' that takes n and returns a function that multiplies its argument by n.
hints: Inner function should use n from outer scope
Return the inner function (not call it)

title: Simple Decorator
description: Create decorator 'uppercase' that converts function's string return value to uppercase.
hints: Decorator is a function that takes a function
Define wrapper function inside that calls original and modifies result

title: Decorator with Arguments
description: Create decorator 'repeat' that takes n and calls the function n times.
hints: Decorator with arguments needs three levels of functions
Outer takes n, middle takes func, inner is wrapper

title: Recursive Function
description: Define recursive 'countdown' that prints numbers from n down to 1.

title: Recursive Factorial
description: Define recursive 'factorial' that returns n!.

title: Memoization Pattern
description: Define 'fibonacci' with memoization using a cache dict (passed as default arg).
hints: Check if n in cache before calculating
Store result in cache before returning

title: Callback Function
description: Define 'process' that takes a list and a callback function, applies callback to each element.

title: Partial Function Application
description: Use functools.partial to create 'add_five' from a general 'add(a, b)' function.
hints: Use partial(add, 5) to fix first argument

title: Simple Generator Function
description: Define generator 'count_up' that yields numbers from 1 to n.
hints: Loop from 1 to n and yield each number

title: Function with Type Hints
description: Define 'add' with type hints: takes two ints, returns int.
hints: Use def add(a: int, b: int) -> int:
Type hints don't enforce types, just document them

title: Using any() and all()
description: Define 'has_even' that returns True if list has any even number. Define 'all_positive' that returns True if all numbers are positive.
hints: Use any(x % 2 == 0 for x in lst)
Use all(x > 0 for x in lst)

title: Custom Zip Function
description: Define 'pair_lists' that takes two lists and returns list of tuples (like zip).

title: Function Currying
description: Define 'add' that takes one argument and returns a function that takes another argument and adds them.
hints: Return lambda that uses outer argument
def add(a): return lambda b: a + b

title: Function Composition
description: Define 'compose' that takes two functions f and g, returns function that computes f(g(x)).
hints: def compose(f, g): return lambda x: f(g(x))

title: Using functools.reduce
description: Use reduce to calculate the product of [1, 2, 3, 4, 5].
hints: reduce(lambda a, b: a * b, numbers)

title: Avoiding Mutable Default Arguments
description: Define 'append_to' that appends item to list. Use None as default and create new list if None.

title: Function Annotations
description: Define 'greet' with parameter 'name' annotated as str and return type str. Return 'Hello, {name}!'.
hints: Annotations are in the syntax but not enforced

title: Unpacking Arguments
description: Define 'add_three' that takes three arguments. Call it by unpacking list [1, 2, 3].
hints: Define def add_three(a, b, c): return a + b + c

title: Function with Side Effects
description: Define 'append_and_return' that appends item to list and returns the modified list.
hints: Lists are mutable, so changes persist

title: Pure Function (No Side Effects)
description: Define 'add_item' that returns new list with item added, without modifying original.

title: Functions as First-Class Objects
description: Define 'apply_twice' that takes a function and value, applies function to value twice.
hints: Call func(value) once, then call func on result again

title: Early Return Pattern
description: Define 'divide' that returns a/b, but returns None if b is 0 (early return).
